tr.td: Purpose: BasicWidget is an abstract superclass for widget that can have an enabled state.

ColorLookup is used to find an appearance color attribute value for a Widget such as foreground, background etc. The following rules apply:
if the widget does not specify an appearance then try its parent in the widget tree
if the widget does not specify an appearance and has no parent then use the default value
CompositeWidget is an abstract widget container.

Widget is an abstract superclass for all terminal widgets This class provides common behavior and state for specifying a Panel that can be displayed on a terminal client.
name - the unique name of the widget (is required for the constructor)
bounds - this rectangle specialization represents the area in which the receiver is displayed.
parent - this field holds the parent widget (unless the receiver is on top)
eventTable - this private table holds event to message connections for the receiver

WidgetAppearanceHolder is the abstract class for all objects that can have a WidgetAppearance assigned. A WidgetAppearance can either be specified by the name of a style (from a StyleSheet) or directly by an instance of WidgetAppearance.
